original: @381b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @381b rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya ganggo ra pa ri bri tstsh'a n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya ganggo ra pa ri bri tstsh'a n'a ma ma h'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-Gaṅgā-devā-paripṛcchā-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa gangg'a'i mchog gis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa gangg'a'i mchog gis zhus pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra The Questions of Gaṅgādevī

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: de'i tshe grong khyer chen po mnyan yod na dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog ces bya ba zhig gnas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe grong khyer chen po mnyan yod na dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog ces bya ba zhig gnas so //
translated: At that time, in the great city of Śrāvastī, there lived a laywoman named Gaṅgādevī.

original: de nas dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog mnyan yod nas byung nas /
analyzed: de nas dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog mnyan yod nas byung nas /
translated: Then the laywoman Gaṅgādevī left Śrāvastī

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: and went to Jeta's Grove, to Anāthapiṇḍada's park. Having arrived,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and then sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen bzhin du dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog la /
translated: As he sat to one side, the Blessed One, as if he knew what was on the mind of the laywoman Gaṅga’s Crest,

original: gangg'a'i mchog khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes smras so //🔽gangg'a'i mchog @382a *//
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes smras so // gangg'a'i mchog @382a *//
translated: asked her, “Gaṅga’s Crest, where have you come from?”

original: gis gsol pa /
analyzed: gis gsol pa /
translated: Gaṅga’s Crest replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang zhig gis sprul pa la smras te khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes de skad bgyis na /
analyzed: gang zhig gis sprul pa la smras te khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes de skad bgyis na /
translated: if someone were to ask an emanation, ‘Where have you come from?’

original: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
translated: what answer would it give?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa la ni 'greng ba med /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa la ni 'greng ba med /
translated: “Gaṅga’s Crest, an emanation does not stand,

original: 'dug pa med /
analyzed: 'dug pa med /
translated: does not sit,

original: nyal ba med /🔽'ong ba med /
analyzed: nyal ba med / 'ong ba med /
translated: does not lie down,🔽does not come,

original: 'gro ba med /
analyzed: 'gro ba med /
translated: does not go,

original: 'chi 'pho med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med /
translated: does not die,

original: skye ba med na /
analyzed: skye ba med na /
translated: and is not born.

original: 'di nas 'ongs so zhes de ci zhig ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di nas 'ongs so zhes de ci zhig ston par 'gyur /
translated: So what would it be showing by saying, ‘I have come from there’?”

original: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
translated: Gaṅga’s Crest replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
analyzed: ci chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags sam /
translated: “Are all phenomena like magical creations?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin no //
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin no //
translated: “Gaṅgā’s Daughter, they are.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Daughter said,

original: gal te chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad sprul pa lta bu lags na /
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are like magical creations,

original: gangg'a'i mchog khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes ci'i slad du smras /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog khyod da gzod gang nas 'ongs zhes ci'i slad du smras /
translated: why did you say, ‘Gaṅgā’s Daughter, where have you come from now?’”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa ni ngan song du mi 'gro /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa ni ngan song du mi 'gro /
translated: “Gaṅgā’s Daughter, a magical creation does not go to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su mi 'gro /
analyzed: mtho ris su mi 'gro /
translated: it does not go to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro na /🔽ci gangg'a'i mchog kyang ngan song du mi 'gro /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro na / ci gangg'a'i mchog kyang ngan song du mi 'gro /
translated: and it does not go to complete nirvāṇa.🔽So, Gaṅgā’s Daughter, do you not go to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su mi 'gro /
analyzed: mtho ris su mi 'gro /
translated: do you not go to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gro'am /
translated: and do you not go to complete nirvāṇa?”

original: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Daughter replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te bdag gis dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan lags par mthong na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan lags par mthong na ni /
translated: if I saw the female lay practitioner Gaṅgā’s Daughter as other than the nature of a magical creation,

original: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog /
translated: then, Blessed One, the female lay practitioner Gaṅgā’s Daughter🔽would go to the lower realms,

original: ngan song du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba'am /
translated: You will go to the lower realms.

original: @382b mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
analyzed: @382b mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
translated: I do not go to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mchi ba ma lags so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mchi ba ma lags so //
translated: nor do I go to complete nirvāṇa.🔽Blessed One,

original: zhes bdag sprul pa dang bstun du'ang mi rung lags na /
analyzed: zhes bdag sprul pa dang bstun du'ang mi rung lags na /
translated: if it is not suitable for me to be in accord with the emanation,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: then, Blessed One,

original: bdag gis ni dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa'i rang bzhin nas gzhan lags par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag gis ni dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog sprul pa'i rang bzhin nas gzhan lags par ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see the preeminent upāsikā Gaṅga as anything other than an emanation.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar bdag gis ma mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis ma mthong na /
translated: if I do not see it like that,

original: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog ngan song du mchi ba'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog ngan song du mchi ba'am /
translated: then how can I say that the preeminent upāsikā Gaṅga goes to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
analyzed: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
translated: goes to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'chi ba zhes ji skad bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'chi ba zhes ji skad bstan par bgyi /
translated: or goes to complete nirvāṇa?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de lta lags kyis kyang /
analyzed: de lta lags kyis kyang /
translated: even so,

original: g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / bskyod pa dang / spros pa mchis na /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / rlom sems dang / bskyod pa dang / spros pa mchis na /
translated: if there is movement, conceit, agitation, and conceptual elaboration,

original: ji ltar 'di snyam du bdag ngan song du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di snyam du bdag ngan song du 'gro ba'am /
translated: then how can I think, ‘I go to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba'am /
translated: I go to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o snyam du sems lags te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o snyam du sems lags te /
translated: or I go to complete nirvāṇa’?

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni /
translated: The realm of the transcendence of suffering, Blessed One,

original: nam yang ngan song du mchi ba'am /
analyzed: nam yang ngan song du mchi ba'am /
translated: is never going to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
analyzed: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
translated: never going to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o snyam du sems lags te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'o snyam du sems lags te /
translated: and never going to complete transcendence.🔽The realm of the transcendence of suffering, Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni nam yang ngan song du mchi ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni nam yang ngan song du mchi ba'am /
translated: is never going to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
analyzed: mtho ris su mchi ba'am /
translated: never going to the higher realms,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mchi ba ma lags te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mchi ba ma lags te /
translated: and never going to complete transcendence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog kyang de lta bu'i dbyings can lags so //
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog kyang de lta bu'i dbyings can lags so //
translated: the laywoman Gāndhāri is also such a realm.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @383a *// gangg'a'i mchog khyod ci yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam /
analyzed: @383a *// gangg'a'i mchog khyod ci yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam /
translated: “Gāndhāri, have you not entered into complete transcendence?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: She replied, “Blessed One,

original: su zhig gis mi skye ba la smras te /
analyzed: su zhig gis mi skye ba la smras te /
translated: who would say this to one who is unborn?

original: khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la ma zhugs sam zhes de skad bgyis na /
analyzed: khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la ma zhugs sam zhes de skad bgyis na /
translated: If you say, ‘Have you not entered into complete transcendence?’

original: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
translated: What answer will you give?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags yin na /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / mi skye ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags yin na /
translated: “Gaṅga’s Pride, ‘nonarising’ is a synonym for nirvāṇa.

original: de ni ci zhig lan 'debs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni ci zhig lan 'debs par 'gyur /
translated: What answer will you give?”

original: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
translated: Gaṅga’s Pride said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa lags sam /
analyzed: ci chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa lags sam /
translated: are all phenomena the same as nirvāṇa?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Gaṅga’s Pride, it is so.

original: chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so; ;gsol pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs so; ;gsol pa /
translated: All phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa.”🔽Gaṅga’s Pride said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gal te chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa lags na /
translated: if all phenomena are the same as nirvāṇa,

original: gangg'a'i mchog khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes da ci zhig smra ste /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes da ci zhig smra ste /
translated: why did you just say to me, ‘Gaṅga’s Pride, have you not entered into complete nirvāṇa?’

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: su zhig gis sprul pa la smras te /
analyzed: su zhig gis sprul pa la smras te /
translated: who would speak to an emanation?

original: khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes de skad ces bgyis na /
analyzed: khyod yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes de skad ces bgyis na /
translated: If someone were to ask you, ‘Have you not entered into complete nirvāṇa?’,

original: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji skad lan 'debs par 'gyur lags /
translated: what would you say in reply?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / dri ba 'di ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / dri ba 'di ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: “Gaṅgadevā, this question is without reference point.”🔽She asked,

original: gsol @383b pa; ci bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i smra bas smras lags sam /
analyzed: gsol @383b pa; ci bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i smra bas smras lags sam /
translated: “Has the Blessed One spoken with reference points?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / dri ba 'di ni dmigs pa med mod kyi /🔽'on kyang 'khor 'di na rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / dri ba 'di ni dmigs pa med mod kyi / 'on kyang 'khor 'di na rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: “Gaṅgadevā, this question is indeed without reference point.

original: rigs kyi bu mo 'dul ba dag yod de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo 'dul ba dag yod de /
translated: Nevertheless, in this assembly there are sons and daughters of noble family who are disciplined.

original: de dag gis don chen por 'gyur bas dris so //
analyzed: de dag gis don chen por 'gyur bas dris so //
translated: Since they will benefit greatly, I have answered.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos nyid ces bya ba yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas na /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos nyid ces bya ba yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas na /
translated: Gaṅgadevā, the Thus-Gone One has not fully awakened to what is called ‘reality’,

original: gang de las byung ba'i chos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lta ga la zhig yod /
analyzed: gang de las byung ba'i chos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa lta ga la zhig yod /
translated: so how could there be any phenomenon that arises from it and abides in complete nirvāṇa?”

original: gsol pa / gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos nyid ces bgyi ba yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
analyzed: gsol pa / gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos nyid ces bgyi ba yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
translated: He asked, “If the Blessed One did not fully awaken to the so-called nature of phenomena,

original: de las byung ba'i chos lta ga la zhig mchis par gyur na /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i chos lta ga la zhig mchis par gyur na /
translated: how could there be any phenomena that arise from it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi slad du ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsgrubs lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub kyi slad du ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bsgrubs lags /
translated: Blessed One, how did you accomplish the roots of virtue for the sake of awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / gang dmigs pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / gang dmigs pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma yin te / byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba de ni gang gi tshe /
translated: “Gaṅgā’s Crest, that which is observed is not the roots of virtue.🔽When the bodhisattvas accomplish

original: yang dag par sgrub pa de'i tshe yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa de'i tshe yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid mi 'dor ro //
translated: those roots of virtue, they do not abandon the inconceivable.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag par mi sgrub pa de'i tshe yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag par mi sgrub pa de'i tshe yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid mi 'dor ro //
translated: When they do not accomplish them, they also do not abandon the inconceivable.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He asked, “Blessed One,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bgyi ba /
translated: why is the inconceivable called ‘inconceivable’?”

original: ci'i slad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa @384a *//🔽zhes bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa @384a *// zhes bgyi / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why is the inconceivable called inconceivable?”

original: gangg'a'i mchog / chos 'di ni sems pas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / chos 'di ni sems pas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Gaṅgadevā, this Dharma is not to be attained through thought.

original: sems pas thob par bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sems pas thob par bya bar mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be attained through thought.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sems nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sems nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
translated: Because the mind itself is not observed.

original: gang sems las rab tu byung ba'i chos lta ga la yod /
analyzed: gang sems las rab tu byung ba'i chos lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be a Dharma that arises from the mind?

original: gangg'a'i mchog / sems mi dmigs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / sems mi dmigs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: Gaṅgadevā, the nonobservation of the mind is called the inconceivable continuum.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de ni thob pa ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de ni thob pa ma yin /
translated: That which is the inconceivable continuum is not attained,

original: mngon par rtogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ma yin /
translated: not realized,

original: shes pa ma yin /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin /
translated: not known,

original: mngon sum du byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa ma yin te /
translated: not actualized.

original: de ni thob par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: de ni thob par bya ba ma yin /
translated: It is not to be attained,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
translated: not defiled,

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
translated: and not purified.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gangg'a'i mchog / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar nges par thugs su chud de /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar nges par thugs su chud de /
translated: Ganga-devi, it is like this: the Tathagata has realized that all dharmas are like space.

original: gangg'a'i mchog / chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa gnyen po med pa'o //
translated: Ganga-devi, all dharmas are like space, without an antidote.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Ganga-devi said, Bhagavan,

original: gal te chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa gnyen po ma mchis pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa gnyen po ma mchis pa lags na /
translated: if all dharmas are like space, without an antidote,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs zhes btags pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes btags pa dang / phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzugs zhes btags pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes btags pa dang / phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
translated: then why did the Bhagavan designate form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination,

original: zag pa dang @384b bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes btags pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: zag pa dang @384b bcas pa dang / zag pa ma mchis pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes btags pa ji lta bu lags /
translated: What are the designations of the contaminated and the uncontaminated, the afflicted and the purified, saṃsāra and nirvāṇa?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / bdag bdag ces 'dogs kyang bdag gang yang mi dmigs pa de bzhin du gangg'a'i mchog ngas /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / 'di lta ste / dper na / bdag bdag ces 'dogs kyang bdag gang yang mi dmigs pa de bzhin du gangg'a'i mchog ngas /
translated: “Gaṅga’s Daughter, it is like this:

original: gzugs zhes btags te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes btags te /
translated: Just as the self is designated, yet no self is observed, in the same way, Gaṅga’s Daughter, I designate form,

original: gzugs gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: yet no form is observed.

original: de bzhin du ngas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes btags te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes btags te /
translated: Similarly, I designate feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: yet no consciousness is observed.”

original: phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang ngas btags te /
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar yang ngas btags te /
translated: the aggregates, the elements, the sense sources, dependent origination, the contaminated, the uncontaminated, the afflictive, the purified, saṃsāra,🔽and nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: I have designated nirvāṇa, but nirvāṇa is not apprehended.

original: gangg'a'i mchog 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / smig rgyu rnams la ni chu yong med de /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog 'di lta ste / dper na / smig rgyu rnams la ni chu yong med de /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Child, it is like this:🔽for example, mirages have no water,

original: mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi dmigs so //
translated: and water is not apprehended.

original: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin du ngas gzugs zhes bya bar btags kyang /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / de bzhin du ngas gzugs zhes bya bar btags kyang /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Child, in the same way, I have designated ‘form,’

original: gzugs gang yang mi dmigs so; ;ngas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar btags kyang /
analyzed: gzugs gang yang mi dmigs so; ;ngas tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar btags kyang /
translated: but no form is apprehended. I have designated ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,’

original: rnam par shes pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: but no consciousness is apprehended.

original: phung po rnams dang / khams @385a *//
analyzed: phung po rnams dang / khams @385a *//
translated: the aggregates, the elements,

original: rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar ngas btags kyang /
analyzed: rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bar ngas btags kyang /
translated: I have designated the aggregates, the sense spheres, dependent origination, the contaminated, the uncontaminated, the afflictive, the purified, saṃsāra, and nirvāṇa.

original: don dam par na de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam par na de dag thams cad med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: But ultimately, all of these are nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: gangg'a'i mchog / gang chos la mchog tu 'dzin pa med par tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa de lta bu ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / gang chos la mchog tu 'dzin pa med par tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa de lta bu ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Gaṅgā’s Pride, those who practice pure conduct without grasping at anything as supreme with regard to phenomena, they abide in the pure conduct of the well-proclaimed Dharma-Vinaya.

original: gangg'a'i mchog / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gnas la dmigs nas /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gnas la dmigs nas /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Pride, those who practice pure conduct while fixating on the notion of a self,

original: tshangs pa spyad pa spyod par de dag gi tshangs par spyod pa de ni yongs su ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa spyad pa spyod par de dag gi tshangs par spyod pa de ni yongs su ma dag pa'o //
translated: their pure conduct is impure.

original: zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say this.

original: gang dag tshangs par spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa de dag ni zab mo rgyud chad pa'i chos 'di lta bu 'di thos na /
analyzed: gang dag tshangs par spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa de dag ni zab mo rgyud chad pa'i chos 'di lta bu 'di thos na /
translated: Those who are not completely pure in their practice of celibacy, when they hear this kind of profound teaching that cuts off continuity,

original: dngangs skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngangs skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: will be frightened.

original: de dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su mi 'grol te /🔽de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bskal pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su mi 'grol te / de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bskal pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not be liberated from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress.

original: zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say that they will have an eon of suffering.🔽Gaṅgā’s Pride,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / da ltar ram /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / da ltar ram /
translated: whether it is now

original: nga 'das pa'i phyi na yang rung ste /🔽gang dag zab mo rgyud chad pa 'di lta bu'i chos ston pa de dag la mi @385b gti mug pa dag gsod pa po'i 'du shes bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga 'das pa'i phyi na yang rung ste / gang dag zab mo rgyud chad pa 'di lta bu'i chos ston pa de dag la mi @385b gti mug pa dag gsod pa po'i 'du shes bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: or after I have passed away,🔽those who teach this kind of profound teaching that cuts off continuity will be perceived by ignorant people as murderers.

original: de ltar mi gti mug pa de dag log par zin pas bsad pa'i zhe sdang bskyed nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi gti mug pa de dag log par zin pas bsad pa'i zhe sdang bskyed nas /
translated: In that way, those ignorant people, having generated the hatred of a murderer through their wrong understanding,

original: ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will go to the lower realms.

original: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog gis gsol pa /
translated: Gaṅgā’s Crest said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽rgyud chad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / rgyud chad pa /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽‘severed continuum,’

original: rgyud chad pa zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: rgyud chad pa zhes bgyi ba /
translated: ‘severed continuum’—

original: ci'i slad du na rgyud chad pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du na rgyud chad pa zhes bgyi /
translated: why is it called ‘severed continuum’?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Blessed One said:🔽“Gaṅgā’s Crest,

original: gangg'a'i mchog / chos 'di ni rgyud bcad pa'am /
analyzed: gangg'a'i mchog / chos 'di ni rgyud bcad pa'am /
translated: this Dharma is not a severed continuum,

original: dbye pa'am / rnam par gzhig ga pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbye pa'am / rnam par gzhig ga pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not divided, it is not destroyed,

original: de'i phyir rgyud chad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyud chad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and therefore it is called ‘severed continuum.’

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya /
translated: This is called ‘the limit of reality,’

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyud ces bya'o //
translated: it is called ‘the inconceivable continuum.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: ” Then the Blessed One smiled.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas /🔽'od zer kha dog sna tshogs kha dog du ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgo nas / 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs kha dog du ma 'di lta ste /
translated: Then from the Blessed One’s mouth🔽light rays of many different colors appeared,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung nas /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / btsod ka dang / shel dang / dngul gyi kha dog lta bu dag byung nas /
translated: such as blue, yellow, red, white, purple, crystal, and silver.

original: de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag snang bar byas te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag snang bar byas te /
translated: They illuminated infinite, limitless world systems.

original: 'od kyis khyab par byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par byung ste /
analyzed: 'od kyis khyab par byas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du mngon par byung ste /
translated: Having pervaded them with light, they rose up as far as the Brahma world.

original: slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgor nub bo //
analyzed: slar log nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi sgor nub bo //
translated: Then they returned and disappeared into the Blessed One’s mouth.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda arranged his robe over one shoulder

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /🔽bcom ldan @386a *//
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de / bcom ldan @386a *//
translated: and, kneeling on his right knee,

original: 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: he bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rgyu ma mchis par 'dzum par mi mdzad na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rgyu ma mchis par 'dzum par mi mdzad na /
translated: since the Tathāgatas do not smile without a cause,

original: 'dzum par mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: 'dzum par mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: what is the cause of your smile?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the reason?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: ngas mngon par shes te /
analyzed: ngas mngon par shes te /
translated: I have directly perceived

original: sa phyogs 'di nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa stong gis /🔽gangg'a'i mchog ces bya ba kho na'i dge bsnyen ma sha stag las brtsams te /
analyzed: sa phyogs 'di nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa stong gis / gangg'a'i mchog ces bya ba kho na'i dge bsnyen ma sha stag las brtsams te /
translated: In this very place, one thousand thus-gone ones

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad do //
translated: have taught this Dharma discourse, beginning with the laywoman called Gaṅgādevā.

original: dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad ni rab tu byung nas /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma de dag thams cad ni rab tu byung nas /
translated: All of those laywomen went forth

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: and passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ni dri ma med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ni dri ma med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: this Dharma discourse is called The Stainless.

original: 'di ni dri ma med pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
analyzed: 'di ni dri ma med pa zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
translated: You should remember it as The Stainless.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na /
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught,

original: dge slong bdun brgya dang / dge slong ma bzhi brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong bdun brgya dang / dge slong ma bzhi brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: seven hundred monks and four hundred nuns were liberated from defilements without further clinging.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis lha'i me tog rnams dang / tsandan gyi @386b phye ma rnams mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis lha'i me tog rnams dang / tsandan gyi @386b phye ma rnams mngon par sprul te /
translated: Then the sons of gods of the desire realm and the form realm emanated divine flowers and sandalwood powder

original: bcom ldan 'das la gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gtor nas tshig 'di skad ces /
translated: and scattered them over the Blessed One, saying,

original: 'di ltar grong khyer mnyan yod na /
analyzed: 'di ltar grong khyer mnyan yod na /
translated: “In Śrāvastī,

original: dge bsnyen ma 'di lta bu gnas la /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma 'di lta bu gnas la /
translated: there is a laywoman like this,

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig smra yang /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig smra yang /
translated: who can converse with the Thus-Gone One🔽without her body becoming tired.

original: de'i lus ngal bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar yang gangg'a'i mchog 'di sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas shing /
analyzed: de'i lus ngal bar yang mi 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar yang gangg'a'i mchog 'di sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas shing /
translated: Just as this supreme woman of the Ganges has served the victorious ones of the past,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / yun ring po nas dge ba spyad pa dang / yun ring po nas tshangs par spyad pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa 'di ni ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / yun ring po nas dge ba spyad pa dang / yun ring po nas tshangs par spyad pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa 'di ni ngo mtshar to //
translated: “It is wonderful that you have planted the roots of virtue, practiced virtue for a long time, practiced pure conduct for a long time, and served many buddhas.”

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: “It is wonderful that you have planted the roots of virtue, practiced virtue for a long time, practiced pure conduct for a long time, and served many buddhas.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine sons,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you say.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: This one has planted the roots of virtue by serving the victorious ones of the past,

original: yun ring po tshangs par spyad pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po tshangs par spyad pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: and has practiced pure conduct for a long time.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this,

original: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma gangg'a'i mchog dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: the laywoman Gaṅgadevaprabhā, the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: rejoiced and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: The noble Great Heap of Jewels discourse in one hundred thousand chapters,

original: 'phags pa gangg'a'i mchog gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa gangg'a'i mchog gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the chapter called “The Questions of Ārya Gaṅgānagarbha,”
